from havoc.autoval.lib.host.openbmc import OpenBMC

[docs]    def get_system_logs(self):
        cmd = "cat /var/log/messages"
        return self.bmc_host.run(cmd, ignore_status=True)



[docs]    def get_cpld_fw_version(self):
        cmd = "cat /sys/class/i2c-adapter/i2c-12/12-0031/cpld_rev"
        maj_ver = int(self.bmc_host.run(cmd), 0)
        cmd = "cat /sys/class/i2c-adapter/i2c-12/12-0031/cpld_sub_rev"
        min_ver = int(self.bmc_host.run(cmd), 0)
        return "%d.%d" % (maj_ver, min_ver)


    # Determine the wedge model - Wedge 40, Wedge 100 or Wedge 100S.

[docs]    def get_wedge_model(self):
        switch_model = None

        cpu_output = self.host.run('dmidecode |grep cpu -i', ignore_status=True)

        if re.search(r'.*Intel.*CPU.*\s+C2550\s+.*', cpu_output):
            switch_model = 'wedge40'
        elif re.search(r'.*Intel.*CPU.*\s+E3845\s+.*', cpu_output):
            switch_model = 'wedge100'
        elif re.search(r'.*Intel.*CPU.*\s+D1508\s+.*', cpu_output):
            switch_model = 'wedge100s'
        else:
            switch_model = 'Unknown Wedge'

        return switch_model



[docs]    def fw_update_cpld(self, absolute_path, file_name, destination):
        self.openbmc_copyfiles(absolute_path, file_name, destination)
        cmd = (
            "bash -l -c 'export"
            " PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/bin;cpld_upgrade.sh %s/%s'" % (
                destination, file_name))
        AutovalUtils.log_info("Executing OpenBMC command - %s" % (cmd))
        try:
            res = self.bmc_host.run(cmd, get_result_obj=True)
        except Exception:
            # For any exception, set return code as 0 and continue test.
            res.return_code = 0
            pass
        # 0 for success, all other return codes are consider failure
        if res.return_code != 0:
            raise TestError("cpld update failed:- %s" % res.stdout)
        AutovalUtils.log_info(res.stdout)
        # Connection gets reset so wait for reconnect
        self.host.system_health_check(False)
        AutovalUtils.log_info("Rebooting OpenBMC")
        self.reboot()
        return res.stdout



[docs]    def sensor_data(self):
        cmd = "/usr/bin/sensors"
        out = self.bmc_host.run(cmd)
        return out


    # No sel_clear function support in Wedge OpenBMC. Hence returning True

[docs]    def sel_clear(self):
        return True


    # Power Status of Slot

[docs]    def power_status(self):
        cmd = "/usr/local/bin/wedge_power.sh status"

        AutovalUtils.log_info("Executing OpenBMC %s" % (cmd))
        out = self.bmc_host.run(cmd)
        return out


    # DC Cycle

[docs]    def cycle(self, timeout=1200):
        cmd = "/usr/local/bin/wedge_power.sh reset"
        current_reboot = self.host.get_last_reboot()
        AutovalUtils.log_info("DC Cycling now: %s" % (cmd))
        try:
            self.bmc_host.run(cmd)
        except Exception:
            AutovalUtils.log_info(
                "%s failed, trying to reconnect anyhow" % (cmd)
            )
        self.host.system_health_check(current_reboot, timeout)


    # Power Reset

[docs]    def power_reset(self, timeout=1200):
        self.ac_cycle(timeout)


    # AC Cycle

[docs]    def ac_cycle(self, timeout=1200):
        cmd = "/usr/local/bin/wedge_power.sh reset -s"
        current_reboot = self.host.get_last_reboot()
        AutovalUtils.log_info("AC Cycling now: %s" % (cmd))
        try:
            self.bmc_host.run(cmd)
        except Exception:
            # Command failed, system might either be rebooting already or
            AutovalUtils.log_info(
                "%s failed, trying to reconnect anyhow" % (cmd)
            )
        self.host.system_health_check(current_reboot, timeout)



[docs]    def power_on(self, timeout=1200, last_reboot=None):
        cmd = "/usr/local/bin/wedge_power.sh on"

        AutovalUtils.log_info("Powering on now: %s" % (cmd))
        out = self.bmc_host.run(cmd)

        self.host.system_health_check(last_reboot, timeout)
        return out



[docs]    def power_off(self, timeout=600):
        cmd = "/usr/local/bin/wedge_power.sh off"

        AutovalUtils.log_info("Powering OFF now: %s" % (cmd))
        out = self.bmc_host.run(cmd)

        success = 0
        end_time = time.time() + timeout
        while time.time() < end_time:
            # Sleep for some time to let shutdown complete
            time.sleep(10)
            try:
                self.ping()
            except Exception:
                success = 1
                break
            else:
                continue

        if not success:
            raise Exception("Failed to power down system")
        else:
            AutovalUtils.log_info("Power Down complete")

        return out
